content.description: Start off a small pointed boulder at the base. Pull onto the wall and slab up to a left facing flake. Climb the quartz flake to a small foot ledge. Move up another flake to a bulge (bolt). Finish up the slab to a ring anchor on top. 55

To the right of the arête is an obvious big crack at the entrance to the Mancave. Climb up the large crack to some large blocks/chockstones above your head. Step off the block and follow the large crack on orange rock with great holds inside (#5 and #6 recommended). Make the crux exit moves up the pointed block on top. Walk right to a ring anchor. 35
content.location: The Mancave on the backside of Pinnacle Block

content.description: Start on a large boulder by the cave at the base of the Pinnacle Block. Step off the block onto the wall with gear in a horizontal. Continue up the face past 2 bolts into a flake system (crux) which leads to bigger holds. Pull the bulge and continue up the slab placing gear to a shared anchor with Machete Arete. 60

Located inside the Mancave. Walk in the cave and turn left past a large boulder jammed in the crack. Climb the right facing corner crack with great hand jams and pull over the lip to a ring anchor. 30

This climb is located on the left edge of the Pinnacle Block. Climb up the left edge on some large stacked blocks to a bolt. Pull onto the arête and climb past 3 more bolts. Finish up the easier slab with optional nut placements to the ring anchor on top. 60
content.protection: 4 bolts, nuts will do, ring anchor

content.description: Start 15 uphill and right of Chinos Seven. Climb the quartz face/crack on big holds placing gear when possible. Finish at the trees above. 30

Some thoughts...    This climb has some of the strangest rock ive seen on a route. Stacks of mica embedded in the rock but exposed and protruding. Some seem solid, some more flexible.     climb unprotected, easy slab for 15ft to a small flake system for your first piece of pro. go up flake system and clip a bolt. pull over bulge on a large pinch and climb through crux section clipping 2 bolts enroute. climb towards crack left of ring anchor and protect your second from swing. Ring anchor to your right is shared with $20 Arete-tion.
content.protection: 3 bolts. small selection of cams fingers to hands will suffice. 2 ring bolt anchor.
content.location: start at toe of rock just left of $20 Arete-tion.

content.description: Start at the arête to the right of the Mancave entrance. Follow the slab face/blunt arête past three bolts to the trees above. 35
content.protection: 3 bolts, use trees or walk off

content.description: Located inside the Mancave to the right of Sandys Crack. Climb the steep face on great holds past three bolts to a crack with gear options (nuts). Top out at the ring anchor shared with Sandys Crack. 30

climbs.name: $20 Arete-tion
climbs.fa: James Dickson, Jonathan Garlough & Shane Soucy

content.description: Locate the obvious arête on the right side of the Pinnacle Block. Climb up the unprotected easy quartz slab/arete for 20 to a stance (bolt). Continue up the awesome arête with big holds past a second bolt to a crack and place gear. Finish up the crack to a ring anchor on the left. 50
content.protection: 2 bolts, mid size pieces, ring anchor
content.location: right edge of pinnacle block. just left of the mancave entrance.

content.description: The Pinnacle Block is located to the right of the lower slabs. There is climbing 360 degrees around the block and one must climb a route to gain access to the anchors on top. The back side of the block forms a giant cave feature we have dubbed, "The Mancave".
